text: the AWS activate program has helped us
in many ways where we found the most
help is in the first year of using AWS
we got what's called business support
anytime we had a problem anytime we had
a production issue we were able to get
instant support from the technical teams
that was a huge benefit to my
engineering team my name is an Jane I'm
the founder and CEO of qura Incorporated
what qura does is we help app developers
make their apps more personal by
understanding the users interests who
they are basic demographics so if you
are a Content app and the majority of
your users are 20-some year old females
if I was to open that app for the first
time in today's world what I'm likely to
see is ways to do my makeup so what qura
does is provide each developer with a
portrait of each of their users this
portrait has basic characteristics like
user demographics these are inferred
based on what apps they have on their
cell phone I started qura in um August
of 2013 we were able to get our first
beta up by December of 201 13 and by the
end of 2014 so exactly one year after we
had scaled up to 110 million mobile
devices that were all talking to our
servers if we had to do that anywhere
else or do that on our own it would have
taken way longer than just a year and
now we recently just passed 15 million
devices when we first got started and we
had a mobile SDK the SDK was talking to
our web servers just to collect the data
from the phon all the servers are
running on ec2 the data that we collect
gets stored onto S3 uh from where we
then run map reduce jobs using elastic
map reduce so all the data on S3 is
processed in elastic map ruce which is
then the processed data is then stored
into red shift Dynamo DB and MySQL which
is hosted by the RDS serice so really
our entire business is running on top of
AWS when we first got started for the
first year we got free business class
support this support enabled us to call
the AWS support team at any time any
time of the day and get instant support
and feedback when we had a couple of
production issues the support teams in
Malaysia in the middle of the night were
helping us out uh and helped us debug
our issues uh the second benefit that
we've seen is having direct touch with
the AWS engineering and product teams um
when we were first getting started with
red shift and Dynamo DB the product
teams for those products were helping us
design our architecture to design the
schemas that our databases should use
and that's something we wouldn't have
access to without AWS activate AWS has a
very good ecosystem beyond the fact that
the support team has been able to help
us through our difficult and most
exciting times uh the the other piece
that is was a big part of my decision in
using AWS and something that I've really
seen come true is the uh the ecosystem
that is available online people that are
helping each other out whether it's on
stack Overflow or the Amazon forums uh
so that we can help debug it ourselves
or help find the best way of doing
something and and that's been a very
helpful resource for us as we've scaled
our company
[Music]
